str2: All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From agon; to struggle, literally, figuratively, or genitive case.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To exercise self-control, be continent. Middle voice from egkrates; to exercise self-restraint.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
A crown, garland, honor, glory. From an apparently primary stepho; a chaplet, literally or figuratively.
Corruptible, perishable. From phtheiro; decayed, i.e. perishable.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

word: we [ do it for a crown ]
parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Indestructible, imperishable, incorruptible; hence: immortal. Undecaying.
